case_vignette:
A 3-year-old female presents with her mother for evaluation of a rash present for two days. Mother notes the patient developed a runny nose, cough, and fever four days prior to onset of rash which began as small raised red bumps on the chest and progressively spread to arms and legs. Mother denies any medication exposures or new topical products. Physical examination reveals multiple juicy, monomorphic erythematous pink scattered papules on the arms, legs, buttock with sparing of the chest and back. The patient is up to date with vaccinations. The patient's mother is a healthcare worker.

Physical examination reveals multiple juicy, monomorphic erythematous pink scattered papules on the arms, legs, buttock with sparing of the chest and back. The child is up to date with vaccinations. The parent is a healthcare worker.

I developed a runny nose, cough, and fever, and then a rash appeared as small raised red bumps that spread to my arms and legs.

My parent, who is a healthcare worker, hasn't mentioned any similar symptoms or exposures.

No, I haven't been exposed to any new medications or topical products recently.

I am up to date with my vaccinations.

No, there is no history of similar illnesses in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Measles
